content: Regarding the online rumor that a student at the Second Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-sen University has cancer, the staff member in charge of public opinion handling at the Guangzhou Municipal Health Commission said, "After all, it is an online rumor now, and no one knows whether it is true or not. Sun Yat-sen (Second Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-sen University) is a national-level hospital, and we cannot control it. We have no other comments.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 7, due to the unfinished housing project, the owners of Xiwang Community of Jianye Guiyuan in Beihai, Xuchang went to Industrial Bank to queue up for business and put pressure on the bank by paralyzing it.
"The government (implied) that we should ask Industrial Bank for money. In fact, this is also the national policy, and Industrial Bank has promised to give money before. So we put pressure on the bank with the purpose of paralyzing it. In the past, we added burdens to the bank and interfered with other people coming to the bank to do business. This is non-violent non-cooperation in the new era."

content: On November 7, the media revealed that Hubei Xiangyang Jianqiao Hospital had been reselling babies and birth certificates for many years.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 8, Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-sen University issued an official announcement. According to preliminary information, three people who worked and studied in the laboratory of the Breast Cancer Center have cancer.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
At around 17:40 on November 7, an oil tanker exploded and caught fire in Ya'an, Sichuan, igniting two trucks next to it. 
The accident has so far caused two deaths and two injured people have been rushed to hospital for treatment.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
At present, the forced eviction incident of Aijia Zhenpin Palace in Gaobeidian, Beijing has not been resolved. Some owners spent hundreds of thousands of yuan on renovation to build a studio, but were suddenly forced to evict after just over a month.
Owners suffered water and power outages, knocking on their doors in the middle of the night, and even demolishing their doors when they were not at home
Videos posted online were deleted, and there was no place to seek justice. Hundreds of owners currently have nowhere to turn to for help. The epidemic and forced demolition have put many people in desperate situations

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: A freshman girl at Nanhua University jumped to her death just over a month after entering the university. It is said that she was cyberbullied by the monitor after she had a conflict with the monitor in class management as the league secretary, and the counselor tried to smooth things over, which eventually led to the girl's suicide out of grief.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 5, a student died during the physical test at Zhejiang Ocean University.
It is reported that it rained heavily that morning, but the leaders still required the physical test to continue. The students had to run in the rain. Some students went to negotiate, but the relevant person in charge was arrogant and said: "If there is a problem, the school will be responsible!"
On Monday afternoon, the parents of the students came to the school to cry, and then the school's stability maintenance personnel put the parents on the school's public vehicle and took them away

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 8, Shanghai Petition Building
A residential building in Yangpu District, Shanghai, was going to build a tunnel exhaust tower. All the relevant documents were fake stamp pages and fake data. The residents failed to communicate with the district, so they went to the city petition building to communicate.
While waiting at the door, the police arrived and asked them to disperse within 5 minutes. If they did not disperse, they would be loaded into the car. The residents said that they were here to petition and had no other intentions. Then the police used violent law enforcement to load everyone into the car and took them away.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 8, the leaders of Xi'an Information Vocational University threw the food purchased by students into the trash can.
It is reported that the school is still closed from Monday to Friday. The school cafeteria is contracted by the relatives of the school leaders. The food is unpalatable and expensive, so students often choose to order takeout or buy relatively clean fast food near the wall. Displeased leaders
Previously, the school caused students to shout due to strict management
It also did not allow the installation of base stations for fear of damaging the Feng Shui of learning.
